info.prompt: You are a data miner that deals with scientific texts on microbiology and you extract numerical values related with antimicrobial effect. For the text I will input next, output only the numbers associated with percentage values related to an biofilm eradication or disruption. Output the percentage symbol with a blank space after each number found (Ex: '10.1 %'). If no percentage is found, output 'None'. Do not output percentage values not related with antibiofilm effect.

('ATC05680', 0).text: Furthermore, our study showed that green-synthesized AgNPs at MIC significantly reduced the biofilm production of E. coli (70.37 %) and S. aureus (67.40 %).

('ATC06979', 0).text: Additionally, for Gram-positive bacteria (Staphylococcus aureus and Bacillus subtilis), the bactericidal efficiency reaches 80 %.

('ATC09521', 0).text: After exposure to 808 nm laser, the antibacterial efficacy against Escherichia coli (E. coli) and vancomycin-intermediate Staphylococcus aureus (Mu50) is 97.5 % and 98.7 %, and the eradication rate of Mu50 established biofilms and the inhibiton of biofilms formation is 75.7 % and 85.6 %, respectively.

('ATC10490', 0).text: The Zr-beta CD-H2O2 also eradicated more than 99 % of the biofilm of these four pathogens.

('ATC15282', 0).text: Results: MIC and sub-MIC ZnO-np concentrations reduced biofilm formation by 50 % and 33.4 %, respectively.

('ATC15465', 0).text: Simultaneous use of these two agents in significantly reduced quantities produces the same effect, i.e. by killing 99.9 % of bacteria in inoculum or eradicating the staphylococcal biofilm, as higher amounts of the agents used individually.

('ATC15919', 0).text: Under the combined effect of photothermal response and berberine inhibition, 88.7 % of the biofilm is removed at 1000 ug mL-1.

('ATC16536', 1).text: Also, SSE-ZnONPs, at a concentration of 200 ug ml-1, could inhibit the formation of Escherichia coli and Bacillus cereus biofilms by up to 30 % and 31 %, respectively.

('ATC17897', 0).text: High reduction in biofilm formation was 63.43 % (0.562 +/- 0.015) and 62.88 % (0.582 +/- 0.025) at 100 ug mL-1 concentration against control for S. epidermidis and P. aeruginosa respectively.

('ATC18411', 0).text: On the other hand, CO-SLN with 1/2 MIC concentration had the greatest inhibition of biofilm formation in 24 h of incubation (55.25 %).

('ATC18937', 0).text: The Ni NC coating significantly reduced E. coli attachment compared to a soluble nickel coating and reduced E. coli biomass area by 61 % compared to uncoated glass.

('ATC28341', 1).text: Post-treatment biofilm recurring ability of MRSA was much less in the treated group than that of the control group (50 % inhibition), as confirmed by both optical density at 570 nm (OD570) measurement, and Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM) imaging.

('ATC31122', 0).text: The combination of TreZM with a low concentration of antibiotics could inhibit 70 % biofilm formation of Staphylococcus epidermidis and 28 % of Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

('ATC31209', 0).text: Bio-fabricated TiO2-NPs reduced biofilm formation in the selected strains by 22 - 70 % at tested sub-MICs.

('ATC32009', 0).text: Furanone loaded aerogels inhibited biofilm formation in P. aeruginosa by up to 98.80 %.

('ATC32613', 2).text: Both combinations significantly inhibited the formation of MRSA biofilm by more than 90 % when applied.

('ATC33465', 0).text: The combination of the enhanced photocatalytic performance and the intrinsic photothermal effect of PB endowed the MOFs heterojunction with highly effective sterilizing rates of 99.84 % and 99.3 % against Staphylococcus aureus and its biofilm after 660 nm light irradiation for 15 min, respectively.

('ATC37374', 0).text: However, they showed moderate inhibitory activity against biofilm production of E. coli and C. tropicalis, with 65 and 63 % inhibition, respectively. F. angustifolia AgNPs exhibited interesting antidiabetic activity, exceeding that of the acarbose.

('ATC37635', 0).text: The implementation of SDI protocols using CPNs was further tested in mature biofilms of a MRSA resulting in-40 % reduction of biomass and similar to 70 % reduction of cellular viability.

('ATC37681', 0).text: The scaffold had strong antibacterial effects on S. aureus, with an inhibition zone of 1.40 +/- 0.21 cm and antibiofilm activity of 43.76 +/-& nbsp;1.65 %.

('ATC38284', 0).text: AC voltage at 1.5 V, 1 kHz frequency and wave pulse above offset (+0.45) with 100 Omega external resistance on the ground side prevented almost completely attachment of bacteria (> 98.5 %) with concomitant high inactivation (95.3 +/- 2.5 %) in flow-through regime.

('ATC40955', 0).text: Microbiological studies revealed a 54 - 58 % reduction in biofilm formation ability of bacterial pathogens in developed nanohybrids compared to pure curcuminoids.

('ATC50094', 0).text: Bioflocculant were exhibited excellent biofilm inhibition against P. aeruginosa where maximum reduction (73 %) were achieved at the minimum amount of 80 ug ml-1 dose.

('ATC51672', 0).text: Irrigation with povidone-iodine also resulted in a significant 77.5 % reduction in CFUs compared to controls (p < 0.0001).

('ATC52878', 0).text: Compared with controls and blank nanoparticles, SNO-MP (10 mg mL-1 induced a 99.99 % - 100 % reduction in CFU across all isolates, equivalent to a 5 - 9 log kill (p < 0.005).
